file_content.text: My men will have those Republic traitors rounded up in no time.
Your Republic prisoners are ready for extraction. And you can stop worrying about Kal Bedo.
That's what I want to hear! With Bedo out of the way, my boys can round up the prisoners swiftly.
I took down the Kaleesh enforcers. Your Republic prisoners are ready for extraction.
That's what I want to hear! My boys'll round them up before Kal Bedo makes any more trouble.
Let's hope those prisoners have something useful to tell us.
Hopefully their info is good.
No question. With what they know about Senate loyalties, you've done a major service to the Empire.
Good to wrap this up.
Likewise. With what these traitors know about Senate loyalties, you've done a great service to the Empire.
If you kept a tighter leash on your men, Bedo never would've known about the extraction.
This mess was your fault.
Yes, I'll keep that in mind for the future. If you'll excuse me, I've got an operation to finish.
Take down Bedo's muscle and open the solitary confinement cells. My unit will extract the prisoners when you're done.
Okay, Tark--these are our terms: a shuttle off this rock for me and my men, and one million credits, hard currency.
Make it happen, or I pick a hostage and start cutting. Kal Bedo out.
Class act, isn't he?
Sergeant Tark, my lord--Intelligence Asset Recovery. How do you feel about helping me solve a hostage crisis?
Sergeant Tark, Intelligence Asset Recovery. How does an operative like you feel about helping me solve a hostage crisis?
Sergeant Tark, Intelligence Asset Recovery. How do you feel about helping me solve a hostage crisis?
Who is this fool who believes himself untouchable?
Tell me about the kidnapper.
Who is this arrogant fool?
Tell me about the kidnapper.
This guy smells like trouble. Who is he?
Tell me about the kidnapper.
What's the brief on the hostage taker?
Tell me about the enemy.
Kal Bedo's an animal. He heads a Kaleesh prison gang, mostly well-armed sadists. He thinks I'm his ticket off Belsavis.
You want my help, be ready for some bloodshed.
My solution is a violent one.
I wouldn't have it any other way. Bedo heads a Kaleesh prison gang made up of sadists and war criminals.
Not interested.
I'm not suggesting diplomacy. Please hear me out.
My unit's here to extract some political prisoners in solitary confinement. Someone tipped Bedo, and his gang took everyone hostage.
In a perfect world, I'd like to find that tipster... but those prisoners are too important to waste any time.
These "political prisoners"--who are they?
Why are they so important?
They're all Republic traitors. High-level people with critical information about loyalties in the Senate.
I intend to pull them out and deliver them to our debriefers. Here's my proposal:
Leave Kal Bedo and his thugs to me.
I'll take care of it.
Perfect! I'll drag out the negotiations with Bedo. While he's distracted, you take out his muscle and break the prisoners out of their cells.
Get to the point.
Those prisoners have critical intel about loyalties in the Senate. I won't dicker over them with a jailhouse thug. Here's my proposal:
I drag out the negotiations with Bedo. While he's distracted, you take out his muscle and break the prisoners out of their cells. What do you say?
Bedo's gangsters will pay for their troubles in blood.
Let's free your prisoners.
We shall teach these fools a lesson in humility.
Let's free your prisoners.
If you've got the pay, I've got the firepower.
Let's free your prisoners.
The intelligence they have sounds too important to ignore.
Let's free your prisoners.
Perfect! That Kaleesh scum will never know what hit them.
When I'm finished, I'll wash the blood from my boots with Kaleesh tears.
I will relish the carnage.
Music to my ears.
By the way--it's not strictly necessary, but if you get a chance to kill Bedo and his lieutenants... well, I won't be heartbroken.
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
Blast it, I guess I'll have to find someone else.
Sorry, I'm waiting for an important call.
